perturbation.original_text: K. ATTORNEY'S FEES. If any arbitration, litigation, action, suit, or other proceeding is instituted to remedy, prevent or obtain relief from a breach of this Agreement, in relation to a breach of this Agreement or pertaining to a declaration of rights under this Agreement, the prevailing party will recover all such party's attorneys' fees incurred in each and every such action, suit or other proceeding, including any and all appeals or petitions there from. As used in this Agreement, attorneys' fees will be deemed to be the full and actual cost of any legal services actually performed in connection with the matters involved, including those related to any appeal to the enforcement of any judgment calculated on the basis of the usual fee charged by attorneys performing such services.
perturbation.changed_text: K. ATTORNEY'S FEES. If any arbitration, litigation, action, suit, or other proceeding is instituted to remedy, prevent or obtain relief from a breach of this Agreement, in relation to a breach of this Agreement or pertaining to a declaration of rights under this Agreement, the prevailing party will recover all such party's attorneys' fees incurred only if mutually agreed upon by both parties. As used in this Agreement, attorneys' fees will be determined at the sole discretion of the judge.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates the prevailing party recovers all attorney's fees. The modified version introduces a contradiction by requiring mutual agreement for the recovery of fees and gives the judge the sole discretion to determine attorney's fees, conflicting with the initial provision.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding attorney's fees clauses.
perturbation.location: VIII. Other Material Terms and Conditions

perturbation.original_text: G. MKOS will not seek to acquire any technologies presented to MKOS by UTEK from the technology developer directly or indirectly for a period of 24 months following the termination of this Strategic Alliance Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: G. MKOS will not seek to acquire any technologies presented to MKOS by UTEK from the technology developer directly for a period of 24 months following the termination of this Strategic Alliance Agreement. However, MKOS retains the right to acquire the technologies indirectly, if done through an unaffiliated third-party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause prohibits indirect acquisition for 24 months. The modified clause allows indirect acquisition through a third party, directly contradicting the original intention and potentially undermining the protection UTEK sought.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding non-compete and exclusivity clauses.

perturbation.original_text:
V. TERM AND TERMINATION

The term of the Agreement will be for 12 months unless terminated sooner. This Agreement may be renewed upon mutual, written agreement of the parties. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time with 30 days written notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
V. TERM AND TERMINATION

The term of the Agreement will be for 12 months unless terminated sooner. This Agreement may be renewed at either party's discretion. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time with 30 days written notice. However, termination is only permissible if both parties agree.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows for termination with 30 days' notice, whereas the changed text requires the agreement of both parties before termination is permissible, contradicting the 'either party' portion of the initial termination term.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding termination clauses.
